question.body: Which of the following is a unique feature of the thyroid gland compared to most other endocrine glands?

multiple_choice.choice: It uses negative feedback to both anterior pituitary and hypothalamus.
It has receptors for tropic anterior pituitary hormones.
It produces and stores its hormone for release as needed.
It produces two different types of hormones.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Even though it does this so do other glands, such as testes, ovary and adrenal gland.
Incorrect. Even though it does have receptors for TSH, several other endocrine glands are also controlled by other tropic anterior pituitary hormones.
Correct. Most endocrine glands produce their hormones when the gland is stimulated.
Sorry, several other glands do this as well, including the pancreas and adrenal gland.

part.hint: Most glands are stimulated to produce and secrete their hormone by the same stimulus.
